<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some other things you can knock off the to-do list tonight so Thursday is a breeze? Make your pie crust, make the roux for your gravy, cube and dry out the bread for your stuffing, and pre-assemble any casseroles. Simple enough.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/23/report-presidentelect-biden-will-nominate-janet-yellen-treasury-secretary?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Congrats If You Had Yellen Moneyline
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="WASHINGTON, DC - DECEMBER 13:  Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen listen..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjE4L2ZlZGVyYWxfcmVzZXJ2ZV9jaGFpcl9qYW4uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Alex Wong/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With all due respect to Gordon Hayward, Janet Yellen will become the hottest free agent signed this offseason. President-elect Joe Biden is expected to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/janet-yellen-is-bidens-pick-for-treasury-secretary-11606161637?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nominate</a> the former Fed chair as the next Treasury secretary, the WSJ first reported. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's a history-making pick. If confirmed, Yellen will become the first woman to lead the Treasury Department. And she'd be the only person ever to occupy the country's top three economic policymaking positions: Fed chair, chair of the Council of Economic Advisers, and Treasury secretary—the financial EGOT. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Quick scroll through Yellen's LinkedIn</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Education: </strong>Undergraduate economics degree from Brown and a PhD in economics from Yale.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Work highlights: </strong>In the 1970s, she <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2013/09/25/us/janet-yellen-fast-facts/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first joined</a> the Fed's Board of Governors as an economist. She led the Council of Economic Advisers under President Clinton in the late '90s, and served as Fed chair from 2014–2018. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Skills: </strong>Experienced, organized, and well-respected among the global financial elite. Biden said his Treasury secretary pick would please those across the Democratic party, and Yellen is it. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What does a Treasury secretary even do? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Think of this role as the <a href="https://www.thebalance.com/united-states-secretary-of-the-treasury-3306167?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CFO of the United States</a>. Yellen will advise the president on a broad range of economic issues, from public debt to international sanctions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of course, Yellen's first couple months will be preoccupied with one objective: putting this coronavirus-induced recession in the rearview. Throughout the pandemic, Yellen has called for more spending from Congress to alleviate the suffering of Americans. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What else will be on her agenda? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Managing the U.S.' economic relationship with China</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Helping Biden craft tax proposals</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The future of Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>As Biden's Cabinet comes into view, it's clear he's favoring seasoned vets over hot-shot rookies. Yesterday, we also learned he's tapping longtime foreign-policy adviser Antony Blinken as secretary of state and former Secretary of State John Kerry as special presidential envoy for climate. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/23/astrazenecas-vaccine-major-implications-developing-countries?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This Vaccine Is Not Like the Rest
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An illustration of shots with red liquid lined up against a pink background" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjE5L3ZhY2NpbmUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, a third major Covid-19 vaccine, co-developed by AstraZeneca and Oxford University, <a href="https://apnews.com/article/astrazeneca-vaccine-third-cheaper-oxford-c99d26eb2946f6fde45a1edc002ff028?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">posted promising results</a> from late-stage trials.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The vaccine was 62% effective when delivered as two full doses a month apart, and 90% effective as a half dose followed by a full dose. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">AstraZeneca is <a href="https://www.foxbusiness.com/healthcare/covid-19-vaccine-highly-effective-prevention?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still conducting</a> additional analysis, but it's planning on seeking early or emergency approval from global regulators. If it gets the nod, AstraZeneca could have a two-dose shot ready by year-end and 3 billion doses next year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The really exciting bit: </strong>AstraZeneca's vaccine can be stored at fridge temperatures for at least six months, making it easier to distribute than Pfizer's or Moderna's. And because it uses more traditional vaccine methodology (Pfizer's and Moderna's are mRNA-based), it can be shipped out through existing distribution systems.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This is huge news for the developing world. AstraZeneca <a href="https://www.axios.com/oxford-astrazeneca-vaccine-developing-world-doses-cfbbbc8d-3cd0-4b63-93b9-6331bef54552.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">doesn't plan on</a> profiting from its vaccine and will distribute doses at cost (a few bucks a pop). The company has committed 300 million doses to a WHO initiative for equitable vaccine access and another 1 billion for developing countries. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/23/snapchat-rolls-tiktok-competitor-spotlight?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Social Media Product Development Meetings
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Lots of spidermans in a circle pointing at each other" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjIyL3RlY2hfc3BpZGVybWFucy5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Toby Howell</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Snapchat announced yesterday it's rolling out a <a href="https://www.axios.com/snapchat-launches-spotlight-tiktok-competitor-db60a7d1-d4b5-41c6-bfd7-5818d07e8628.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">short-form video competitor</a> to TikTok in 11 countries, including the U.S.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Meet "Spotlight"</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Snap's TikTok clone lives in its own tab within the app and will allow users to create vertical videos of up to 60 seconds that can be spiced up with music and visual effects, like Snap's filters.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Snapchat is Snapifiying it, though:</strong></span><span> Spotlight user profiles will be private by default and, as of now, the company is barring reuploads of videos originally posted to TikTok. It wants to ensure the content you see on Spotlight was </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/11/23/21585513/snapchat-snap-spotlight-creators-app-update-tiktok?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">created specifically</a></span><span> for Spotlight. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To make sure that Spotlight content gets created, Snap is adopting the "pay people a ridiculous amount of money" approach. Snap is dishing out $1 million <em>per day </em>to creators who pump out the best-performing videos on the platform.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Snap, whose "Stories" feature has been famously copied by Instagram, Linkedin, Twitter, and more, is finally getting its first taste of playing catch-up. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The quadrennial changing of the White House guard can quickly reshuffle business allegiances. Yesterday, GM CEO Mary Barra <a href="https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-lawsuits-environment-california-gavin-newsom-f30458eb13b6ff967d05b12c178621e8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pulled her company's support</a> for a Trump administration lawsuit against the state of California. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> In September 2019, President Trump <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/18/president-trump-continues-emissions-war-california?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tried to revoke</a> California's ability to set stricter emissions standards than those imposed by federal regulators. California, the U.S.' largest auto market, generally passes tighter regulations that set the tone for other states and automakers.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>GM joined Fiat Chrysler, Toyota, and several smaller automakers in supporting the White House. The coalition argued inconsistent regulations between states would drive up prices. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Barra had also previously asked the president to weaken federal tailpipe pollution standards set by the Obama administration (a rollback that was finalized in March).</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>Barra is trying to buddy up to Biden, who's made supporting the electric vehicle industry a priority for his administration. GM has been going all-in on electric, and last week <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/19/electric-vehicle-roundup-gm-ups-investments-uk-accelerates-gas-vehicle-ban?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">upped</a> its planned investments in electric and autonomous vehicles to $27 billion over the next five years. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here:</strong> Potentially faulty air bags are forcing GM to <a href="https://apnews.com/article/gm-recalls-7M-vehicles-globally-277b41b68a4c92eec5c2578808b5c26a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recall</a> 7 million pickup trucks and SUVs. It’ll cost the automaker an estimated $1.2 billion.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/23/bitcoin-ethereum-altcoins-remain-heater?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
If Bitcoin Is Shrek, Ethereum Is Donkey
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Shrek sitting with donkey" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=383 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/pKBZfGcYcgzrG/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Shrek sitting with donkey" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/pKBZfGcYcgzrG/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bitcoin is flirting with all-time highs, but that other cryptocurrency you might have heard of, Ethereum, has actually been outperforming big, bad bitcoin over the last 12 months.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Alts are also rockin’</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bitcoin is the biggest, but hardly the only, cryptocurrency out there. Alternative coins (altcoins) like Ripple and Litecoin have been <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/23/bitcoin-price-ether-xrp-and-other-altcoins-rally.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">trending upwards</a> in part because they're drafting on bitcoin's months-long bull market. Broadly speaking, "Bitcoin leads and the altcoins follow," Peter Wall, CEO of London-based Argo Blockchain, told CNBC.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ethereum, in particular, is having a banger of a 2020 because of the hype around DeFi.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">DeFi = Decentralized Finance, </strong></span><span>a movement to build </span><span><a href="https://www.coindesk.com/what-is-defi?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decentralized versions</a></span><span> of traditional financial instruments like lending platforms, options trading, and currency exchanges. DeFi systems are typically built using Ethereum's blockchain technology. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Altcoins in general have a stigma because of the lack of regulation and a laundry list of horror stories involving scammy coin offerings. But, as DeFi gains more traction and institutional investors <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/bitcoin-is-surging-in-2020-and-nearing-its-all-time-high-heres-why-131445541.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warm up</a> to bitcoin, altcoins could benefit. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Dept. of Warm Fuzzies
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2020 has been so challenging, we probably don't need to end this sentence with an explanation on why it's been challenging. Aside from Dolly Parton and anyone who bought Zoom stock in January, this year has been one of the worst in recent memory for many. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But maybe...and hear us out...not completely? We've seen a few diamonds in the rough and silver linings in the storm cloud, plus we've added some new clichés to our repertoire. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For example: Some Brew Crew members adopted pets (and plants), while others paid off their student loans. A few of us even got in shape. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As we head toward Thanksgiving, the holiday where we express gratitude, we want to ask you: What unexpected gems have fallen into your lap in 2020? What brought you joy this year? <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/eC43jnxt?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tell us here</a>, we'll share some reader responses in tomorrow's newsletter, and we can all get weepy together. </p>
</td>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eAlex Wong/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith all due respect to Gordon Hayward, Janet Yellen will become the hottest free agent signed this offseason. President-elect Joe Biden is expected to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/janet-yellen-is-bidens-pick-for-treasury-secretary-11606161637?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enominate\u003c/a\u003e the former Fed chair as the next Treasury secretary, the WSJ first reported. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt's a history-making pick. If confirmed, Yellen will become the first woman to lead the Treasury Department. And she'd be the only person ever to occupy the country's top three economic policymaking positions: Fed chair, chair of the Council of Economic Advisers, and Treasury secretary—the financial EGOT. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eQuick scroll through Yellen's LinkedIn\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEducation: \u003c/strong\u003eUndergraduate economics degree from Brown and a PhD in economics from Yale.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWork highlights: \u003c/strong\u003eIn the 1970s, she \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2013/09/25/us/janet-yellen-fast-facts/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst joined\u003c/a\u003e the Fed's Board of Governors as an economist. She led the Council of Economic Advisers under President Clinton in the late '90s, and served as Fed chair from 2014–2018. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSkills: \u003c/strong\u003eExperienced, organized, and well-respected among the global financial elite. Biden said his Treasury secretary pick would please those across the Democratic party, and Yellen is it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat does a Treasury secretary even do? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThink of this role as the \u003ca href=\"https://www.thebalance.com/united-states-secretary-of-the-treasury-3306167?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCFO of the United States\u003c/a\u003e. Yellen will advise the president on a broad range of economic issues, from public debt to international sanctions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOf course, Yellen's first couple months will be preoccupied with one objective: putting this coronavirus-induced recession in the rearview. Throughout the pandemic, Yellen has called for more spending from Congress to alleviate the suffering of Americans. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat else will be on her agenda? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eManaging the U.S.' economic relationship with China\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHelping Biden craft tax proposals\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe future of Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAs Biden's Cabinet comes into view, it's clear he's favoring seasoned vets over hot-shot rookies. Yesterday, we also learned he's tapping longtime foreign-policy adviser Antony Blinken as secretary of state and former Secretary of State John Kerry as special presidential envoy for climate. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, a third major Covid-19 vaccine, co-developed by AstraZeneca and Oxford University, \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/astrazeneca-vaccine-third-cheaper-oxford-c99d26eb2946f6fde45a1edc002ff028?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eposted promising results\u003c/a\u003e from late-stage trials.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe vaccine was 62% effective when delivered as two full doses a month apart, and 90% effective as a half dose followed by a full dose. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAstraZeneca is \u003ca href=\"https://www.foxbusiness.com/healthcare/covid-19-vaccine-highly-effective-prevention?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estill conducting\u003c/a\u003e additional analysis, but it's planning on seeking early or emergency approval from global regulators. If it gets the nod, AstraZeneca could have a two-dose shot ready by year-end and 3 billion doses next year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe really exciting bit: \u003c/strong\u003eAstraZeneca's vaccine can be stored at fridge temperatures for at least six months, making it easier to distribute than Pfizer's or Moderna's. And because it uses more traditional vaccine methodology (Pfizer's and Moderna's are mRNA-based), it can be shipped out through existing distribution systems.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is huge news for the developing world. AstraZeneca \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/oxford-astrazeneca-vaccine-developing-world-doses-cfbbbc8d-3cd0-4b63-93b9-6331bef54552.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edoesn't plan on\u003c/a\u003e profiting from its vaccine and will distribute doses at cost (a few bucks a pop). The company has committed 300 million doses to a WHO initiative for equitable vaccine access and another 1 billion for developing countries. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS Yesterday, GM CEO Mary Barra \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-lawsuits-environment-california-gavin-newsom-f30458eb13b6ff967d05b12c178621e8?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epulled her company's support\u003c/a\u003e for a Trump administration lawsuit against the state of California. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e In September 2019, President Trump \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/18/president-trump-continues-emissions-war-california?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etried to revoke\u003c/a\u003e California's ability to set stricter emissions standards than those imposed by federal regulators. California, the U.S.' largest auto market, generally passes tighter regulations that set the tone for other states and automakers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGM joined Fiat Chrysler, Toyota, and several smaller automakers in supporting the White House. The coalition argued inconsistent regulations between states would drive up prices. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBarra had also previously asked the president to weaken federal tailpipe pollution standards set by the Obama administration (a rollback that was finalized in March).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003eBarra is trying to buddy up to Biden, who's made supporting the electric vehicle industry a priority for his administration. GM has been going all-in on electric, and last week \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/19/electric-vehicle-roundup-gm-ups-investments-uk-accelerates-gas-vehicle-ban?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eupped\u003c/a\u003e its planned investments in electric and autonomous vehicles to $27 billion over the next five years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we’re here:\u003c/strong\u003e Potentially faulty air bags are forcing GM to \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/gm-recalls-7M-vehicles-globally-277b41b68a4c92eec5c2578808b5c26a?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecall\u003c/a\u003e 7 million pickup trucks and SUVs. It’ll cost the automaker an estimated $1.2 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBitcoin is flirting with all-time highs, but that other cryptocurrency you might have heard of, Ethereum, has actually been outperforming big, bad bitcoin over the last 12 months.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAlts are also rockin’\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBitcoin is the biggest, but hardly the only, cryptocurrency out there. Alternative coins (altcoins) like Ripple and Litecoin have been \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/23/bitcoin-price-ether-xrp-and-other-altcoins-rally.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etrending upwards\u003c/a\u003e in part because they're drafting on bitcoin's months-long bull market. Broadly speaking, \"Bitcoin leads and the altcoins follow,\" Peter Wall, CEO of London-based Argo Blockchain, told CNBC.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEthereum, in particular, is having a banger of a 2020 because of the hype around DeFi.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDeFi = Decentralized Finance, \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ea movement to build \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/what-is-defi?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edecentralized versions\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of traditional financial instruments like lending platforms, options trading, and currency exchanges. DeFi systems are typically built using Ethereum's blockchain technology. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAltcoins in general have a stigma because of the lack of regulation and a laundry list of horror stories involving scammy coin offerings. But, as DeFi gains more traction and institutional investors \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/bitcoin-is-surging-in-2020-and-nearing-its-all-time-high-heres-why-131445541.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewarm up\u003c/a\u003e to bitcoin, altcoins could benefit. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable
